WorkPlace.Name: Adecco
WorkPlace.OrganizationDescription:
Adecco er markedsleder, når det gælder vikar- og rekrutteringsløsninger.
Sådan er det både globalt og lokalt, hvor vi har 12 kontorer fordelt rundt omkring i landet. Dermed er vi både tæt på dig og vores kunder.

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Plant Engineering & Maintenance Manager to the largest fermentation Plant in the World
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
For our great costumer Remilk, who is on a mission to introduce a new generation of real dairy - cleaner, healthier, and so much better for our planet, without using a single cow! Adecco are looking for a Plant Engineering & Maintenance Manager

As part of the rapid growth plan of Remilk, we are about to construct and operate the world’s largest fermentation plant. This high-volume manufacturing plant (HVMP) of Remilk will be located in Kalundborg Denmark. We are looking for the right team to lead the project and the site in the years to come.

Do you want to be part of a mission to introduce a new generation of real dairy without using a single cow? Are you passionate to become a pioneer and execute your Engineering & Maintenance visions? Then you might be the one we are looking for.

Who are we looking for?

You are an exceptional Engineering Manager and an experienced leader with technical expertise and skills to execute a maintenance strategy that ensures plant reliability and fosters a continuous improvement of culture.

The new Plant Engineering & Maintenance Manager at Remilk will have the responsibility to support the first Greenfield project, lead the plant Projects and Maintenance team and to provide technical expertise and utilize leadership skills to deliver plant operations results. Further, you will play a major role in the global engineering team.

Your focus will be to support the ongoing local site mass production, to recruit the Engineering & Maintenance team, and to perform excellence in all engineering aspects of

  • Infrastructure and equipment maintenance
  • Production process scale-up and control
  • Project execution

In addition, you will continuously focus on reducing costs and improve production efficiency on site.

You are a true people person, who enjoy leading your team. Furthermore, we imagine that you possess

  • Technical expertise and refined leadership skills
  • Ability to collaborate and manage employees from different professional and cultural backgrounds
  • High level of self-direction
  • Entrepreneurial spirit by nature

To succeed in this role, you have a background from an industrial organization, with at least 7 years of experience in a high-volume microbial fermentation plant – you also have

  • A relevant B.Sc. degree in - Chemistry, Mechanical or Bio-technology engineering
  • Experience with directly leading a team of engineers
  • Proven record of working in Greenfield/Brownfield Projects
  • Excellent communication skills, high level of spoken and written English (Skills in an additional language is an advantage)
  • Willingness to travel abroad
  • Strong identification with Remilk’s mission

It is an advantage if you have a relevant background in a food or pharmaceutical industry and a necessity to have a strong identification with the Remilk’s mission.

We offer you a once in a lifetime opportunity where you will wake up every morning to a mission of making the world a better place. A challenging position in a global company, with excellent opportunities to support Remilk’s fermentation plant.

About Remilk

Remilk is a fast-growing, leading food-tech company that uses microbes to produce the key ingredients in milk. The newly build plant located on Sjælland will have a crucial influence on the dairy industry in Denmark.

Remilk HVMP will be the largest fermentation plant in the world in terms of installed fermentation capacity, with a full downstream (filtering and drying) process capability, and a highly automated production.

Do you want to join the journey?

Do you have questions about the position, or do you want to hear more good reasons why you should become the new Plant Engineering & Maintenance Manager of this exiting and once in a lifetime opportunity? Do not hesitate to contact Senior Recruitment Specialist from Adecco, Liselotte Schwanenflügel +45 2893 8983.

Send your CV by pushing the ‘apply’-button below.

Do you know someone?

If this is not the job for you and you know someone who would be interested – please feel free to share this job post. Thank you for the referral.
